sentence: Type: CI, response: What is a mutagen?

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Characteristics of Fungi The study of fungi is called mycology.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Mycologists (scientists who study mycology) have determined fungi as one of the kingdoms, or divisions, of living organisms.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  All members are of this kingdom have cell walls which contain chitin.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Chitin is the same material that is found in the exoskeleton of insects.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Most members of the kingdom Fungi are multicellular (made up of many cells) organisms.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microscopic molds and yeasts make up the majority of this kingdom.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi are also heterotrophs, thus they get their energy from the environment.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  One subtype of heterotrophs is called a saprophyte, which gets their energy from dead organic material.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The ends of the fungi release enzymes to decompose and release organic material into the environment, which then may be absorbed.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This kind of saprophyte is found on dead trees or plant litter such as leaves.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some examples are Gem-studded Puffball (Lycoperdon perlatum) and Turkey Tail (Trametes versicolor).
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Parts of a Fungus Fungi are made up of hyphae.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Hyphae are long filaments or strings.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These filaments make up an interconnected mat of hyphae called mycelium.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This is the major portion of the fungus and is often found hidden in the nutrient material.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Hyphae are divided into sections called septa.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These septa allow different functions to occur in adjacent septa and also provide support for the hyphae.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Reproduction of Fungi The portion of the fungus that serves as the reproductive structure is the portion that is usually seen.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi are able to reproduce both sexually and asexually.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The sexual reproduction often occurs with the production of spores.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Three ways that fungi produce spores are conidia, sporangiosphores, and fragmentation.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some fungi produce spores outside the hyphae on a structure called conidia.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The production of spores inside a specialized hypha structure is called sporangiosphores.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fragmentation, on the other hand, occurs when hyphae release individual cells that act like spores.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Sexual reproduction occurs between “plus and minus” mating types.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These mating types fuse and give rise to a specialized structure that produce offspring.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Asexual reproduction, which does not require two fungi, occurs rapidly when the fungi grows under favorable conditions.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Yet if stress and unfavorable conditions are placed on the fungi, then sexual reproduction is more likely to occur.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Uses of Fungi The uses of fungi are both positive and negative.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some fungi produce medicines, such as penicillin, cephalosporin antibiotics, and cortisone.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi have also been used in the genetic engineering.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For instance a vaccine for hepatitis B was developed using the yeast plasmid as the vector.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Yeast is used to make ethanol and also known to make bread rise.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Mushrooms, morels and truffles are eaten around the world, but not all fungi are edible.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi also form symbiotic relationship with other organisms.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A symbiotic relationship is a beneficial relationship.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Lichen is a symbiotic relationship between an algae and fungi.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are also negative uses of fungi.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Allergies are often triggered by mold.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi also causes skin, nail and hair infections.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some common infections are athlete’s foot and ringworm.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Microbiology usually includes the study of bacteria, fungi, parasites, and viruses.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Each of these microbes has unique characteristics.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The majority of bacteria take in nutrients through unique paths such as absorbing light or decomposing elements in their environments.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi are a different kingdom of organism that is made up of hyphae, or long filaments, which absorb nutrients from the environment.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Parasites are small microorganisms that get their nutrients from a host organism and typically do harm to the host.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Viruses are the smallest microbes and require a host organism to reproduce.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Each of these four microbes is known to cause infectious diseases.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What are Ebola and Marburg?
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Ebola and Marburg fevers are severe diseases, which often lead to death.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Ebola and Marburg are clinically almost indistinguishable from one another.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Marburg hemorrhagic fever was first identified in 1967 after workers in Europe developed hemorrhagic (bleeding) sickness after working with tissue from green monkeys.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Later, researchers determined that a virus in the Filoviridae family caused the outbreak.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Several years later, highly lethal hemorrhagic fevers were seen in Africa.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The cause was found to be newly identified members of the Filoviridae family.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These viruses, once transmitted to a human, can be spread between people by contact.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, a health care worker could acquire an infection by handling blood, or other body fluids, from a person already sick with Ebola.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Symptoms of Ebola and Marburg These fevers do not appear until several days after being infected.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The symptoms include fever, aches, and even bleeding.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The diagnosis is difficult since the symptoms are so similar to many other infectious diseases.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Thus, doctors would isolate suspected causes until tests can confirm this viral infection.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are no drugs to treat these fevers.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  However, sick people are provided support in isolation, such as intravenous fluids.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Measles, also known as rubeola, is a respiratory infection.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The measles virus causes this infection.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Since it is a virus, it infiltrate cells in the human body in order to reproduce and grow.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Measles is an infection of humans and not other animals.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The virus typically infects cells in the throat and lungs.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  An infected person coughing or sneezing spreads the virus.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some of the symptoms are a red rash, fever, cough, and runny nose.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It may take one to two weeks for symptoms to appear, yet the infected person is contagious four days before the rash appears.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Measles may lead to many complications, such as diarrhea, ear infection, pneumonia, encephalitis or even death.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This disease has been virtually eliminated in the United States, the rest of North America, South America and some other areas through widespread vaccinations.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Unfortunately, the disease remains prevalent in Africa and Asia.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There is no specific treatment for measles, but the symptoms may be treated to provide some comfort for the sick.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Measles is very dangerous to pregnant women.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What prevents people from getting common infectious diseases like influenza and chicken pox?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  One way to avoid disease is to get immunized.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Being immune means that a person has built up resistance, or antibodies, against a given disease.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The most common way to be immunized is to visit your doctor or health care provider and request a vaccine.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A vaccine is typically a shot that contains a weakened or dead form of the infectious disease, or “germ.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: ” The body is tricked into thinking that a germ has infiltrated it, and the body immediately begins making antibodies to fight against it.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Antibodies are proteins in the blood that can detect an outside invader to the body.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  As soon as the antibody is alerted to outside attack from germs, chemicals are produced that “bind” the invader.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The result is a neutralized germ with no power to harm the normal cells of the body.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Eventually, the invading germ is destroyed.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Sometimes the body needs several doses of a vaccine over an extended period of time in order to build up enough resistance.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The body’s cells develop a memory of the germ so that if they encounter the germ again, they will immediately begin producing the appropriate antibodies and destroy the germ.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Through widespread vaccination programs, disease can be controlled and eventually eliminated.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Smallpox, for instance, was eliminated through worldwide vaccination programs.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Other infectious diseases are becoming more rare in the United States, such as polio.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It is important to get vaccinations to keep up society’s level of immunity.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Interim Report - March 12, 2012 The illness has spread through camp quickly.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bryce assigned me to investigate the disease before the EIS Agent arrives.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  I haven't narrowed down a diagnosis, but I have read a lot about diseases and microbes.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  I took notes, but I seem to have temporarily misplaced them.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Hopefully I will find my notes soon.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In addition to reading books and research articles, I spoke with Ford and Robert, our team's virus and bacteria experts.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They have shared lots of helpful information about infectious agents.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They have also put up informative posters around camp.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  I have been working with Elise in the laboratory to run tests on potential transmission sources.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  We have a scanning device that can test a wide range of objects for contaminants.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  No tests have come out positive yet, but I hope that something will turn up soon.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  I need to do a better job recording my findings in one place.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Maybe I can find a diagnosis worksheet around here somewhere.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A worksheet would be helpful for organizing data, as well as communicating my findings.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It would be much better than trying to memorize everything! Anyway, I am eager to continue my investigation, but first I need to get some rest.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  I'm starting to feel under the weather myself.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  - Dr.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Defining Carcinogen Cancer is the uncontrolled growth of damaged cells.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Any substance that is directly involved in causing cancer is called a carcinogen.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Carcinogens cause problems by damaging the DNA of organisms or disturbing cells' internal processes.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Unfortunately, there are many different kinds of carcinogens, including certain types of pollution, medical treatments, and building materials.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some types of radiation are considered carcinogenic.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act (CERCLA) classifies all radionuclides as carcinogens.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Radionuclides are unstable atoms that have excess energy, which may be emitted as alpha, beta, gamma, or neutron radiation.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The strength of radionuclides is based on the type of radiation emitted, exposure, and penetration.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  However, there are also types of radiation that are not considered carcinogenic, such as radio waves, infrared radiation, and visible light.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Additional Examples of Carcinogens There are many additional examples of carcinogens beyond radiation.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, inhaled asbestos, tobacco smoke, and even some dioxins are carcinogenic.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Benzene has been listed as a dioxin that causes cancer.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Since the 1930s, tobacco smoke has been classified in this way.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some viruses are also listed as carcinogens.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Hepatitis B, C and some human papilloma viruses are listed as carcinogens.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Tumors were the first identified physical change caused by carcinogens.
labels: cause

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Optical Microscopes were invented sometime during the 16th century.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They were invented in order to see objects too small to be seen by the unaided eye.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Using a series of lenses to focus and enhance light, the special shape of the glass can make objects that are the size of a bacteria cell appear large enough that you can watch the bacteria dividing.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The practice of looking at small things became popular after Robert Hooke published Micrographia in 1665.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The illustrations were so amazing for the time that other scientists immediately became interested in studying small plants and animals.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Optical Microscopes are used in many fields of science in order to view the structure of small objects or to make counts of small objects.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The small objects are known as samples or specimen.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The most relevant use of microscopes to everyday life is in the food industry.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microscopes are used in food labs to examine everything you eat for health risks such as harmful bacteria and mold.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Conversely, in cultured food like yogurt and cheese, microscopes are used to count cells and make sure the right amounts of beneficial bacteria are in each serving.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are several parts that all optical microscopes have in common.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The piece you use to see the sample is called the eyepiece.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It is basically a magnifying glass that can enlarge an image usually about 10 times.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The eyepiece is arranged to focus the objective lenses.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The objective lenses are where the real power of the microscope comes from.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Generally three to four lenses are arranged in a way that they can enhance each other’s image by multiplying the magnification.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, if two lenses can magnify just 4 times each on their own, but are arranged and focused like a microscope, they could make a sample look 16 times the original size! Using this method of complementary lens arrangement means that optical microscopes can have up to 1500 times magnification.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Other parts to an optical microscope are the tube, arm, and base.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These are the external parts that make a microscope look like what you may picture when you think of a microscope.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The tube holds the eyepiece, the arm supports the tube, and the base supports the entire microscope.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  To see the specimen on the slide there are two knobs that help with the focusing so anyone (regardless of vision) can see the same thing.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These knobs are called the fine focus and coarse focus.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The coarse focus is used to find the object and the fine focus is used to see the maximum amount of detail.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The part that holds the specimen or slide is called the platform.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some microscopes can have multiple viewing settings, or also called objectives.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These objectives located on a rotating support called a turret.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Finally, a bright light source is needed for clear, visible viewing.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Usually this light source is a lightbulb located below the stage and is called the illuminator.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Optical microscopes were the only type of microscopes until the 20th century.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Research into electron streams in vacuums in the late 19th and early 20th centuries led to a device called the cathode ray tube.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This device can direct a stream of electrons utilizing electricity and magnetism.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The most common application of the cathode ray tube is the television.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Another use for cathode ray tubes is looking at how they bounce off objects, much like SONAR underwater.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This is the primary principle involved with the electron microscope.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The invention of the electron microscope revolutionized what it meant to look at small objects.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic: No one wants to be sick.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  You can protect yourself from getting sick by taking the necessary measures to protect yourself.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Infectious diseases are illnesses caused by pathogens.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Examples of pathogens are parasites, bacteria, viruses, and fungi.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Pathogens can be transmitted in several different ways.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Physical contact with contaminated food and water, body fluids, and airborne pathogens are ways that diseases are transmitted.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If a disease is easily transmitted, it is considered contagious.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  How to Prevent the Spread of Disease Pathogens are transmitted or carried by a vector.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A vector could be a person, animal, or microorganism.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Since direct contact is a common means of transmission, the best way to prevent the spread of disease is to properly wash your hands.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Properly washing and cooking foods are also helpful to prevent the transmission of pathogens.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Since respiratory illnesses are spread through inhalation of pathogens, it is helpful to avoid contact with those who are coughing and sneezing.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bodily fluids may also carry pathogens.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Therefore, you should avoid contact with bodily fluids.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Definition Microbes are small organisms, which cannot be seen without a microscope.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Examples of microbes are bacteria, fungi and protozoa.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Many microbiologists also include viruses in the study of microbes, even though viruses are unlike other microbes and are only able to reproduce when inside the cells of other organisms.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Many microbes cause diseases in plants, animals, and even humans.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Examples of diseases caused by these harmful microbes are malaria, anthrax, and HIV.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Malaria is one of the most common infectious diseases and is caused by protozoan parasites of the genus Plasmodium.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microbes can also be a virus.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Human Immunodeficiency Virus causes the well known HIV disease.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Anthrax disease is caused by Bacillus anthracis, a type of bacteria that comes from spores.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The anthrax spores are also single celled microbes.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microbial disease Unfortunately, these harmful microbes invade the human body.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  While the bacteria, fungi, and protozoa reproduce independently to cause harm, viruses must invade individual cells and then use the cell’s systems to reproduce and then harm their hosts.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What is Influenza?
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Influenza, better known as the flu, is contagious infection that affects the respiratory system.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The severity of the flu ranges from mild to severe or even lead to death.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The flu has several different types, A, B, and C.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They are categorized by the protein composition in the flu virus microbe.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The flu virus is a round virus with a unique layer of spikes on the surface.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The spikes help copied viruses get out of the host or stick to the cell.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Flu may infect humans, birds, and other animals.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Symptoms of Influenza According to the National Institute of Allergy and Infection Diseases, some or all the symptoms of the flu may be seen in an infected person.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The symptoms are fever, cough, sore throat, aches, fatigue, and runny or stuffy nose.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The flu spreads through direct contact with the virus.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The virus can live in the tiny drops from coughing, sneezing, or talking.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The drops may land on a person or be picked-up by a person who then touches their mouth, eyes or nose.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A key line of defense against spreading flu is proper hand washing especially during flu season.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Infected people are contagious before developing symptoms and for several days after the symptoms occur.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Since the symptoms are similar to many other infections, a doctor’s exam can help determine if a person is infected with the flu.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The diagnosis can be confirmed with a test.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Prevention of Influenza The elderly, young children, pregnant women and people with chronic medical conditions have a greater risk of developing complications from the flu.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Complications include pneumonia, ear infections, sinus infections, and/or worsening chronic medical conditions.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The flu vaccine is the best way to prevent the flu.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The Centers for Disease Control (CDC) recommend that everyone 6 months and older get the flu vaccine each year.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The vaccine should be taken in the fall each year.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are two ways to get the vaccination.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The shot vaccine has an inactive or killed virus, which is injected with a needle.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The nasal spray vaccine has a live, weakened virus, which is sprayed into the nose.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The body has produced antibodies to protect the person against the flu two weeks after vaccination.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The vaccine changes each year.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Correct food preparation and storage can be one of the greatest preventatives in foodborne illness.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If food is handled properly and prepared at appropriate temperatures, then the likelihood of contracting food poisoning becomes much less.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  However, if care isn’t taken at every stage, then the risk of food contamination increases.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Imagine that your family has prepared a delicious meal where poultry, such as turkey, was served.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Proper storage for the turkey didn’t begin after the dinner was over; instead it began when your family bought the bird at the store.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The turkey must remain frozen and stored at a proper temperature until prepared.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If the turkey’s storage temperature dips into the “danger zone” then the probability of the meat causing a foodborne illness grows.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The range of temperature between 5 degrees Celsius and 60 degrees Celsius is a danger zone for food.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Within this temperature range, bacteria can grow and multiply at alarming rates.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Although all food contains a certain number of bacteria, the number of bacteria is generally too low to harm healthy humans.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  However, when food is left in the danger zone, it is possible for bacteria to multiply every 10-30 minutes.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  That means that food with only two bacterium cells can number in the millions in less than 8 hours.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This would certainly be enough bacteria to make a human sick.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Although proper food storage and temperature won’t guarantee the eradication of foodborne illness, it certainly can aid in keeping the consumer healthy.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Streptococcus Pneumoniae Description Streptococcus Pneumoniae are bacteria found in the upper respiratory system.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The severity of the bacterial infection ranges from minor ear infections to fatal meningitis.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The infection can affect children and adults, but the elderly and very young are the most at risk.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  According to the World Health Organization (WHO), over a million people die from pneumococcal infections each year.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Pneumonia, meningitis, and sepsis are the three most common ways that pneumococcus kills people.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Sepsis can kill a person as the infection overwhelms the immune system.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Meningitis infection causes damage to the spinal cord and brain.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Pneumonia Treatment Pneumonia is diagnosed in several ways.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In some cases, a doctor can use a stethoscope and observe breathing rates to diagnose the disease.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The most precise way to diagnose pneumonia is by using a chest X-ray.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The infection is most often treated with antibiotics.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Because bacteria have become more resistant to common antibiotics, more advanced and expensive antibiotics have to be prescribed.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A pneumococcal vaccine is currently given to all United States infants.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This widespread vaccination policy has basically eliminated childhood pneumococcal diseases.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What are parasites?
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Parasites are organisms that can only live on, or in, a host organism from which it gets food or assistance in some life stage.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  According to the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, most human diseases are caused by three sets of parasites: protozoa, helminthes, and ectoparasites.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Protozoa are single-celled organisms.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Helminthes are worms.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Ectoparasites are lice and other arthropods.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Protozoa paracites often live in water.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Drinking infected water can cause diarrhea or a serious abscess to the human liver.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Parasitic worms can enter the body through the soil (bare feet) and poorly cooked meat.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Head lice are actually small insects that attach themselves to hair, eyebrows, and eyelashes.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Treatment and Prevention of Parasitic Illnesses According to the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, parasites cause many illnesses--and even deaths--in the tropical and subtropical areas of the world.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are no vaccines to prevent many parasitic infections.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In fact, many treatments are not effective either.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Parasites are actually becoming more drug resistant.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Even some of the most effective drugs are failing.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic: How Does Salmonella Spread?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Salmonellosis, commonly known as salmonella, is a disease that is responsible for many food poisoning incidents around the world.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Salmonella is a bacterium that lives in the intestinal tracts of animals and humans.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Humans are typically infected by eating foods that are contaminated with salmonella bacteria.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some common types of contaminated foods are fruits, vegetables, poultry, beef, and dairy products.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Salmonella can also infect humans from contact with animals such as pets, birds, fish, dogs, cats and turtles.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  What are the Symptoms of Salmonellosis?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some common symptoms include diarrhea, dehydration, fever, and abdominal cramps.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Symptoms usually appear within 12-72 hours after exposure and can last for up to a week.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Children are most likely to contract salmonellosis.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  How Can the Spread of Salmonella be Prevented?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  To prevent salmonellosis, thoroughly clean and cook all foods when preparing meals.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Washing your hands and kitchen counters with soap and water after preparing raw meat, fruits, and vegetables helps prevent the spread of salmonella bacteria.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What is a virus?
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A virus is a microscopic infective agent that depends on a host to receive nutrients to reproduce.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Unlike bacteria, which are complex single-cell organisms, viruses only contain genetic material surrounded by a protein coating.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Viruses can only reproduce other viruses once it has nutrients.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, the T4 bacteriophage virus can attach itself to the E coli bacteria and inject genetic material directly into it.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The injected genetic materials quickly reproduce with a special code for producing more and more similar viruses.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Ultimately, once many viruses are produced, the original bacteria cell explodes.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  After this, these viruses move about to more bacteria and continue to reproduce in new bacteria hosts.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The viruses cannot reproduce on their own; they must use the bacteria host to reproduce.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For this reason, some strains of E coli bacteria are very deadly.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Transmission of these bacteria usually occurs through contaminated food or water, following contact with animals, and occasionally from person to person.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  What are the differences between viruses and bacteria?
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are several differences between viruses and bacteria.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The first major difference is size.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Viruses are much smaller than bacteria cells.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Another difference is that bacteria are alive and reproduce on their own, whereas viruses are not considered alive and they need to have hosts to reproduce.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Most viruses are harmful to their hosts.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In contrast, bacteria can often be helpful.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, some bacteria help the environment through the decomposition of waste products.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Recently, scientists have discovered a way to change the genetic make-up of some viruses.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The changed virus is used as a type of drug to fight diseases such as cancer.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Have you ever noticed that the milk label from the grocery store says, “Pasteurized“?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Have you ever wondered what that means or why it should be pasteurized?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Pasteurization is the process in which raw milk is heated to a given temperature, for a set amount of time, and then quickly cooled.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This is an important process because raw milk and dairy products made from raw milk may contain harmful bacteria.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Salmonella, E coli and Listeria may be found in raw milk.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These and other harmful bacteria are killed during the heating process of pasteurization.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What is E coli?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  E coli is the abbreviation for the bacteria named Escherichia coli.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These are among the most studied bacteria in the world.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The bacteria normally live in the intestines of animals and humans.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Most of the strains, or types, of bacteria are harmless.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In fact, E coli is a probiotic organism.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It grows and crowds out disease causing bacteria.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It can also make vitamin K, which humans need to be healthy.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The toxin- producing forms of the bacteria are called Shiga toxin-producing E coli (STEC).
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, one type of the E coli bacteria produces severe diarrhea and kidney damage.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The elderly and the very young are the most prone to complications, but anyone may become infected.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Where is E coli found?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  E coli can be found many different places.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Since E coli lives in the intestines of animals, beef or venison can be infected during slaughtering.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If the meat is rare or improperly cooked, the E coli can be transferred to a healthy person.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If fresh veggies are not properly cleaned or handled, contamination can also occur.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In addition to food contamination, contamination could occur from improper hand washing after using the toilet or diapering.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Contaminated drinking or swimming water can also cause sickness.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  What are the symptoms?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  According to the National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, once a person has been infected with E coli, symptoms may occur 2 to 5 days after infection.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The infected person may have mild diarrhea or even no symptoms at all.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The initial symptoms are diarrhea or stomach cramps, possibly followed by blood in the stool.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A low fever is sometimes present.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The infected person should always see a doctor and the doctor may order special laboratory tests to diagnose whether or not the person is infected by E coli.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A blood test to check for toxins, and a culture to grow the organism, are the two most common tests.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Growing a culture is when microbes are allowed to reproduce in closed, controlled conditions.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The symptoms typically go away on their own and it is advised that antibiotics and diarrhea medicines are not used.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Not all diseases have the same means of transmission.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some diseases are infectious, while others are genetic.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Infectious diseases are caused by an invading organism (pathogen) entering the body of a host.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, streptococcus pneumoniae bacteria can invade the human body, and cause a person to become ill with pneumonia.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  An infectious disease can be avoided by not coming into contact with the pathogen.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  On the other hand, genetic diseases are caused by modified DNA within an organism.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Examples of genetic diseases include sickle cell, cystic fibrosis, and Tay-Sachs.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These diseases may be passed from parents to offspring by changes in their genetic material.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What is food safety?
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This year one in six Americans will get sick by eating contaminated food.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Keeping our food supply safe by safely handling, preparing, and storing food is very important.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Various techniques of keeping our food safe from contamination, pathogenic bacteria, viruses and chemicals is known as food safety.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These pathogens enter the food supply at various points of food preparation such as cleaning, cooking or during storing the food.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are four simple steps given by USDA Fight BAC! Campaign which is a food safety initiative designed to educate consumers about the four food safety principles—clean, separate, cook, and chill.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The campaign’s goal is to provide consumers with information and resources to help them reduce the risk of food borne illness.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  How do you prevent food borne illness?
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The USDA suggests four steps to help prevent food borne illness at home: clean, separate, cook and chill.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The first step, “clean,” encourages you to wash their hands before, during and after handling the food.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The second, “separate,” encourages you to keeping raw meat separate from vegetables to avoid pathogens from one food migrating to another, or cross-contamination when preparing meals or even in the refrigerator.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The third step, “Cook” encourages us to use of food thermometer.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Only a food thermometer can make sure meat, poultry, fish and casseroles are cooked to a safe internal temperature.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic: How Do Bacteria and Viruses Reproduce?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteria and viruses have different methods of reproducing.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteria can reproduce through asexual and sexual reproduction.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The bacterium’s cell splits into two cells, which are exact clones of the original cell.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This is an example of asexual reproduction.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Sexual reproduction involves two cells sharing genetic information and producing a genetically different offspring.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteria are able to reproduce on their own.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Viruses, on the other hand, are unable to reproduce independently.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A virus is simply genetic material in a membrane.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Viruses do not have the mechanisms to reproduce on their own.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What are vaccines?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Vaccines are an important line of defense against the spread of infectious diseases.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Vaccines allow people to develop immunity so that they do not get the disease in the future.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A vaccine works by introducing a weak or dead microbe to the body.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When the body recognizes the foreign microbe, it immediately begins to fight against it.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Once the microbe has been defeated, some of the body’s fighting cells turn into memory cells.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These memory cells are then prepared to fight against the same type of microbe later on, if the body is introduced to it again.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Infectious disease before vaccination Some infectious diseases, like diphtheria and pertussis, devastated people throughout the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When an outbreak of these diseases occurred, hundreds and even thousands of people often died.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In 1918, the great influenza epidemic of the U.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: S.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  killed thousands of people.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some people even died within hours after becoming ill.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Vaccination today The National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases conducts research that helps lead to the development of new and improved vaccines.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In the twentieth century vaccines were developed for many diseases, such as influenza.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  As more and more people were vaccinated, the spread of disease and number of deaths decreased.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: How Can You Prevent the Spread of Bacteria When Prepping and Cooking Food?
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  According to the U.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic: S.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Department of Health and Human Services, one in six Americans could get sick from food poisoning alone this year.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When handling food, before and after cooking, we need to make sure that we are mindful of how to protect ourselves from harmful bacteria that causes food poisoning.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are many different ways that we can contaminate our food and our bodies if we do not follow food safety tips and cooking labels.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It is important to clean your hands, surfaces, and utensils throughout your kitchen when you are getting ready to prepare food.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteria that cause us to get ill can live throughout our kitchen and if you do not clean the surfaces the right way then you are putting yourself and others at risk of getting sick from bacteria.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  As you start to prepare a meal you need to make sure that you are careful with how you prep certain foods so that you do not cross-contaminate your food.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This is important so that you do not spread bacteria throughout your kitchen and also between different foods.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteria can easily spread between surfaces and foods when you are preparing a meal if you are not mindful of the surfaces and utensils you are using.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When you are cooking a variety of foods it is important to carefully follow the directions so that we do not put ourselves at risk for getting food poisoning.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are recommended cooking temperatures for a reason.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When food does not reach the recommended temperate then bacteria that causes us to get food poisoning multiplies quickly.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Poliomyelitis, also known as polio, is an infectious disease that can cause paralysis or even death in a small percentage of people.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The infection is caused by the poliovirus.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The poliovirus typically invades the host’s cells in the throat and intestinal tract to reproduce and grow.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Polio is highly contagious.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It is spread by an infected person’s coughs, sneezes or contact with an infected person’s stool.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Polio is notable because over 70% of infected patients experience no symptoms.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  About 24% of infected people have minor flulike symptoms.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Less than 5% develop stiffness in the back or legs.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Less than 1% develop paralysis of the limbs.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A very small percentage of those who develop paralysis develop paralysis in the respiratory muscles and ultimately die.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If a person is infected, they may spread the disease even if they do not show any symptoms.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This polio disease had many outbreaks in the United States in the 19th and first half of the 20th century.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, or CDC, is headquartered in Atlanta, GA.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It was originally called the Communicable Disease Center.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When it was organized in 1946, the original charge of the agency was to fight malaria.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Now called the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, this government agency leads the nation and the world in “health promotion, prevention, and preparedness.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: ” The agency monitors diseases across the nation and around the world.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The CDC works to develop strategies for disease prevention.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The organization develops and shares scientific knowledge with the public and it trains health professionals.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Many infectious diseases are the result of contaminated food.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Through proper handling and preparation of food, the number of food borne illnesses can be decreased.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention states “foodborne ailments cause about 325,000 hospitalizations and 5,200 deaths nationwide each year.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic: ” Food safety starts at the grocery store.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When buying raw meat, keep it separate from other food while it is in the shopping cart and grocery bag.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  You should try to prevent meat drippings from falling on other items.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  While driving home, do not allow refrigerated and freezer items to be out of the cold for more than two hours.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteria can begin to grow on these products if kept out of the cold for too much time.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Once home, cut up raw meat and store it separately from fruits and vegetables.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When cooking, use separate utensils for raw meat to avoid cross contamination.
labels: food

sentence: Type: CI, topic: How are bacteria classified?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The world is full of millions of living organisms.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These organisms have different physical and genetic features by which they may be classified.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  One segment of the living organisms is bacteria.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Scientists have questioned how to classify these unique organisms.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The first big category is known as a kingdom.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Historically, scientists have classified all bacteria in the Kingdom Monera.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The Kingdom of Monera was then divided into 2 sections, archae and eubacteria.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  But in the 1970s, Carl Woese discovered great genetic variations between archae and eubacteria For this reason, taxonomists abolished the Kingdom Monera and established two separate kingdoms, Archae and Eubacteria.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  What are Archae?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  	 Archae have different material in the cell wall that make them unique from eubacteria.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They are also called extremophiles because they live in extreme conditions where most organisms cannot survive.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For instance, methanogens produce methane gas as a waste byproduct.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They can be found in the guts of grass eating animals and in marshlands.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Halophiles live in environments with high salt concentrations.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Another type of archae is a thermophile and is a type of microorganism that lives in areas of high temperatures.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  What are Eubacteria?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  On the other hand, most bacteria are classified as eubacteria.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These bacteria grow and take in nutrients in different ways.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Nutrients are the materials that the bacteria need to live and grow.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Photoautotrophs are bacteria that get their energy from light.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Saprophytes get their energy by decomposing things.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some bacteria do not need oxygen while others need oxygen to survive.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Yet another group of bacteria can live in the presence of oxygen or can continue to live even if oxygen is not present.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some bacteria live in neutral pH while others live in a slightly more acidic environment.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Definition of Salmonellosis Salmonella is a rod shaped bacterium in the bacillus genus.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Salmonellosis is an illness caused by the bacilli Salmonella.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These bacteria are passed to animals and people through feces.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The Surveillance Report from the Food Diseases Active Surveillance states that salmonellosis is the most commonly reported bacterial infection.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Two types of salmonella bacterium are the cause of about half of human infections.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The infection does not exhibit symptoms in all people.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Most infected patients experience fever, abdominal cramps, and diarrhea within a few hours to a few days of infection.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Most people get better in a few days without seeing a doctor.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  People with chronic medical conditions, the elderly, young children, and pregnant women are at a higher risk for developing serious complications, and they should seek medical attention if salmonellosis is suspected.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Prevention of Salmonellosis Salmonella bacteria live in the intestinal tract of animals and humans.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The bacteria are usually transmitted to humans by eating food that has been accidentally contaminated with fecal matter.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  According to the United Stated Department of Agriculture (USDA), several steps can be taken to prevent the contamination of food.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It is essential that people wash their hands after coming into contact with feces.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Common situations where contact with feces can occur include handling pets, changing diapers, or going to the bathroom.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Food preparation areas and materials should be cleaned thoroughly throughout cooking.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  While preparing food, raw meats should be separated from other foods and separate utensils should be used.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Food should be cooked to the proper internal temperature.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Also, food should be refrigerated properly.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Have you ever been sick and went to the doctor, only to find out that you would leave without any antibiotics?
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Many people feel that if they go to the doctor then they need to leave with medication.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  However, if you have been diagnosed with a viral illness, an illness caused by a virus; then an antibiotic is not necessary.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Antibiotics are substances that affect the growth rate, or even kill, bacteria.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some doctors classify antifungal drugs as antibiotics.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A viral infection occurs when a virus enters a cell in the human body.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The virus, which is a capsid filled with nucleic acid, cannot reproduce without a host cell.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The virus will use the organelles and enzymes of host cell to reproduce and gain energy to function.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Even though many viruses cause diseases, scientists have been able to manipulate the genetic makeup of some viruses.
labels: virus

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What is Microbiology?
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The science of microbiology explores how microbes work and how to control them.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microbiologists and other researchers had many successes in learning how microbes cause certain infectious diseases and how to combat those microbes.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Most microbes belong to one of four major groups: bacteria, viruses, fungi, or protozoa.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A common word for microbes that cause disease is germs.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some people refer to disease-causing microbes as bugs.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  I've got the flu bug, is a phrase you may hear during the wintertime to describe an influenza virus infection.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Scientists call a group of many germs “bacteria”.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A scientist would call one germ a “bacterium”.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Scientists call one virus a “virus” but more than one are called “viruses”.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  What are Microbes?
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microbes are tiny organisms that can only be seen by looking through a microscope.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are two kinds of microscopes, light microscope to view larger microbes and the electron microscope used to view the smallest microbes.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microbes can be found everywhere on the earth.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They live in air, soil, rock, and water.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These microscopic organisms are found in plants and animals as well as in the human body.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Microbes can live in very hot temperatures and some live in extreme cold temperatures.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some microbes need oxygen to live, but others do not.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some microbes cause disease in humans, plants, and animals.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These are harmful microbes.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Others are essential for a healthy life, and we could not exist without them.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These are helpful microbes.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some bacteria are helpful.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example probiotics in the human intestine help with digestion.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Lactic acid bacteria (LAB) and bifidobacteria are the most common types of microbes used as probiotics.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The relationship between microbes and humans is delicate and complex.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Nearly a hundred years ago, researchers began to learn that microbes can cause many chronic diseases and conditions.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Scientific research has shown that microbes may cause some forms of cancer, coronary artery disease, diabetes, multiple sclerosis, and chronic lung diseases.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  An example of harmful bacteria is Anthrax.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This type can cause death.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Another type of harmful bacteria that causes sickness is Salmonella.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This type of bacteria causes the patient to be very sick but doesn’t always cause death.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Viruses are a type of microbe that must have a host cell (such as an animal or plant cell) to reproduce.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A very deadly virus is the Ebola virus.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Parasite A parasite is an organism that lives on, or in, a second species.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This second species is called the host, since it accommodates the parasite in, or on, its body.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The relationship usually works with specific host and not any other.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The parasite will take advantage of the host.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, the parasite may take food or shelter from the host.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The parasite is often the smaller of the two and gains advantages from the host.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The host ends up being harmed by the parasite.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  But this relationship is usually absolutely necessary for the parasite to survive.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Parasitic Diseases For humans, parasitic diseases are often foodborne or waterborne.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  These diseases can be prevented by careful handling food or water, such as the filtering and/or boiling water or cooking food thoroughly.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, the parasitic tapeworms can infect a person if they eat rare infected meat.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some tapeworms are contracted by eating raw, infected fish.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The hookworm infection causes the disease trichinosis and comes from infected pork.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The hookworms Ancyostoma and Necator, which infect over 400 million people, enter through the feet of a person.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Thus wearing shoes in likely infected areas is a preventative measure.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Washing one's hands before handling food can reduce transmissions of parasites from pets.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Malaria is an infection caused by a member of the parasite family of Plasmodium.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Similarly, the disease commonly referred to as sleeping sickness is caused by another parasite carried by insects such as the tsetse fly called Trypanosoma.
labels: parasite

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Fungi are one of the kingdoms, or major types, of living organisms.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In order to be classified as a member of the fungi kingdom, an organism's cell wall must contain chitin.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some common examples of fungi are molds and yeasts.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi do not produce their own energy, but rather get their energy from the environment.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Organisms that have the ability to take energy from the environment are called heterotrophs.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Saprophytes are a division of heterotrophs, which get their energy from dead organic matter.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Many fungi are hidden in the nutrient materials from which they get their energy.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The hidden portion of fungi is called the mycelium, which is made up of long interconnected filaments.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Uses of fungi Fungi have many uses for humans.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  One of the most important scientific discoveries ever made was by scientist Alexander Flemming.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  He examined the uses of the fungus penicillin.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Sometimes called the “wonder drug”, penicillin can be used to fight many bacterial diseases.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The mushrooms served on a salad or hamburger are considered fungi.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Edible mushrooms are very popular for adding flavor to food, and they are rich in B vitamins.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Fungi are also important for decomposition of waste products.
labels: fungi

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What is an epidemic?
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Pathogens are microbes, or infectious agents, that cause disease in organisms.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some examples of pathogens are bacteria, parasites, viruses, and fungi.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When an outbreak of an infectious disease is much greater than expected, it is called an epidemic.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When an epidemic spreads around the world, it is called a pandemic.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Throughout history, epidemics and pandemics have altered history.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Infectious diseases such as ebola and influenza have sparked epidemics.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  For example, an influenza pandemic in the early 20th century was especially devastating.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  According to the National Archives, more people died from the 1918 flu pandemic than the first World War.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In this outbreak, influenza infected 20% of the world’s population.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What is Anthrax?
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacillus anthracis bacteria are the cause of the disease Anthrax.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This bacteria lives as a spore in the soil, and it germinates and reproduces bacteria once inside an animal or human.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Anthrax typically affects livestock, but it can also affect humans.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are three different types of anthrax.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The most common form is cutaneous anthrax, which affects the skin.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  It occurs from direct contact with spores or bacteria.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Inhalation anthrax occurs when the spores are inhaled and begin infection in the lungs.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Humans may also get anthrax by eating meat contaminated by anthrax spores or bacteria.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  This type is called gastrointestinal anthrax.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Vaccines and Diagnosis There is a vaccine available for anthrax, but it is not recommended for the general public.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Multiple doses are required over an extended period of time.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Anthrax is not a common disease, and the vaccine is only recommended for people who are in the military or have a job that puts them in contact with livestock or slaughtered animals.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases currently supports research to develop new vaccines for anthrax, which may eventually be available to a wider population.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Blood cultures or sputum cultures may be used to diagnose the disease.
labels: disease

sentence: Type: CI, topic: Disease prevention is important for maintaining a healthy society.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  There are two main ways to avoid spreading infectious diseases.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Physical contact is one way diseases are transmitted.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Properly washing hands is an important way to remove microorganisms.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Washing and cooking food to the proper temperature will also help prevent the transmission of infections.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Avoiding contact with those who are coughing and sneezing is another strategy.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Physical contact with infected bodily fluids also should be avoided.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Vaccinations are another way diseases may be prevented.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Vaccines help prevent diseases such as polio and measles.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Vaccination involves injecting a weak or dead form of the pathogen into a patient.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The human or animal body then recognizes the infection and makes antibodies to destroy it.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If the body encounters the disease again, the cells will fight the infection again.
labels: prevention

sentence: Type: CI, topic: When a person bakes cookies, he follows a recipe.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  When a scientist approaches a problem or wishes to discover new knowledge, she uses a recipe for problem solving called the scientific method.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Unlike a recipe, which is linear, the scientific method is cyclical.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The scientific method begins with a problem.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The problem must first be identified.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  After gathering background information, a hypothesis--a possible solution for the problem--should be created.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The hypothesis can be tested by performing experiments and collecting data about the problem.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  After collecting observational data, the problem and/or hypothesis may be redefined, which leads to more experimentation.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  If the original data was satisfactory, then the data can be analyzed.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Analysis involves careful examination of the data in order to detect patterns, differences, or trends observed in the experiment.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The conclusions from the analysis are then shared with other scientists and the public.
labels: method

sentence: Type: CI, topic: What are bacteria?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteria are microorganisms, which perform many different functions in the world.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some bacteria are used in the production of cheeses and fermented meats.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Other bacteria are used to make pharmaceutical products.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Recently, bacteria have even been used to reduce pollution.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Are bacteria harmful?
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Most bacteria are not harmful.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  A few, however, cause human diseases such as listeria and shigellosis.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Listeria is a type of bacteria found in soil, water, and even some poultry and cattle.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Listeria is unusual in that it is able to grow in cold spaces like the refrigerator.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The elderly, pregnant women, and the chronically ill are most susceptible to serious illness from listeria.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Shigella cause intestinal infections called shigellosis.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Shigella bacteria are spread from person to person.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  The most common symptom is diarrhea, and the best treatment is to rest and drink plenty of fluids.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Antibiotic treatment Scientists have also developed a group of drugs that combat bacterial infections called antibiotics.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Antibiotics can be prescribed for listeria infections.
labels: bacteria

sentence: Type: CI, topic: To understand the health of humans and the development of life on earth, we must recognize the vital importance of microbes.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  In the medical field, scientists study disease-causing agents, in an attempt to find methods for prevention and treatment of disease.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Improvements have been made in public health based upon the results of state-of-the-art biomedical research.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Findings of these studies are used to explain how microbes cause infectious diseases in both plants and animals.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Scientists use various techniques and strategies, including computer modeling, cell culture, animal models, and clinical trials in humans in an attempt to analyze the data of the findings.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Safe handling of food and hygiene as well as various anti-microbial chemicals may be used to reduce the risk of and the treatment of various infections.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Industrial microbiology involves quality control in preventing growth and contamination of products leading to food spoilage, and the production of pharmaceuticals.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Understanding of the microbial world has led to the emerging field of biotechnology, which has given us many advances and new careers in medicine, agriculture, genetics, and food science.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Biotechnology, while it has benefited some states in many ways, has also raised many ethical issues for an informed community to consider.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  As we increase our knowledge and make advances in technology we are able to reduce the threat of microbial hazards.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Some examples of careers in microbiology include bacteriologists, food scientists, and molecular biologists.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteriologists examine diverse types of bacteria that cause stomach and intestinal infections as well as wound infections.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They determine what mechanisms or factors are produced by bacteria and aid those bacteria in causing disease.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  Bacteriologists collect samples from hospitals and grow cultures on plates but they do not collect samples directly from people.
labels: microbe

sentence: Type: CI, topic:  They have an indirect impact on patients by developing vaccines and ways to make disease-causing microbes less harmful.
labels: microbe
